evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

roots_spec.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root

slot_statements.availability: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present and observable during the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA flight on 12-25, as evidenced by the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim data.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The explanation of communication/coordination breakdown among crew is resistant to defeaters, as alternative causes have been ruled out based on the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim evidence.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with key features identified in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim data, including timing, context, and crew interactions.

slot_statements.availability: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is observed and documented within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim phase on 12-25.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The identified procedural deviation in pushback execution withstands scrutiny against potential counterarguments or alternative explanations within the context of the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim data.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The procedural deviation in pushback execution aligns with key features identified in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA's operational protocols during the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim phase.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present and observable during the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA flight on 12-25, as evidenced by the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim data.

assumptions: Communication between tug instructor and trainee driver is representative of crew communication
The continued movement beyond TRP indicates coordination failure rather than solely procedural error
defeaters: If evidence showed clear, effective communication and coordination among crew during pushback
If procedural deviations or environmental/marking deficiencies better explained the event

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H2 and H3 show communication and coordination issues between tug instructor and trainee, and H4 shows the aircraft moving beyond the intended stop point, supporting observable communication/coordination breakdown. Discriminators favor communication breakdown over procedural deviation or marking deficiency.
outcome.uncertainty_source: ambiguity in distinguishing communication breakdown from procedural deviation

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is observed and documented within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim phase on 12-25.

assumptions: No mechanical control failure occurred as no fault traces or bench checks are reported
Environmental markings were adequate since the aircraft reached the TRP
Communication was maintained as per H1 and H3, so deviation is procedural
defeaters: If evidence showed mechanical faults or equipment malfunction
If communication breakdown was documented affecting pushback
If environmental markings were inadequate or not visible

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H4 directly documents the procedural deviation in pushback execution, showing the aircraft moved beyond the designated release point and hit a barrier, supporting the claim. H1-H3 describe the crew actions and communication, favoring procedural deviation over communication breakdown or environmental causes. No evidence suggests mechanical failure.
outcome.uncertainty_source: No direct evidence of mechanical failure or environmental deficiency; assumptions made based on absence of such evidence.
